channel.title: Dell Inspiron 17R
channel.description:
So here are the specs for the laptop I have recently purchased. The total overall amount of money I spent was $1,084.92 with accessories added. I was wondering if these specs are worth the money. I did some research and came to conclude the only two issues with this laptop is hot air from the fan and short battery life. So I followed precautions and bought the upgraded battery and a cooling unit. By default, it also includes Adobe Photoshop® Elements 9 and Premiere® Elements 9. It should arrive in 5-7 business days and I'm SOOOOO freaking excited to get off my old Dell Desktop from 2002. :| So here are the specs. /comment
3rd Generation Intel® Core™ i7-3612QM processor (6M Cache, up to 3.1 GHz) Windows® 7 Home Premium, 64Bit, English 17.3" High Definition+ (900p) LED Display with Truelife 8GB3 Dual Channel DDR3 SDRAM at 1600MHz 1TB 5400 RPM SATA Hard Drive 8X Tray Load CD/DVD Burner (Dual Layer DVD+/-R Drive) Intel® HD Graphics 4000 90 days Premium Phone Support + 1 Year In-Home Service after Remote Diagnosis 7.23 lbs

item.title: Dell Inspiron 17R
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

PS: That doesn’t have a dedicated graphics card, so don’t expect it to run high-end games well. Honestly, that’s not worth 1k+. It should be 700 before the discount. Plus, it’s dell and from my experience, dell laptops are unreliable.

Read full topic

item.title: Dell Inspiron 17R
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

The problem here is it’s a Dell, but moreso a laptop. I use a Dell desktop computer but that’s only because the Optiplex series was cheap and upgradable. But as others have said, definitely not worth $1000.

Read full topic

item.title: Dell Inspiron 17R
item.dc:creator: @Fealt Fealt
item.description:
@Fealt wrote:

LOOOOOOOOOLL you got scammed mate, sure everything is good, except the graphics which suck, this may not have as good of a proccessor, but in terms of gaming its so much better, if your just gonna video encode then go with the one you have, but this is 10x better overall and only $600, trust me I searched for 4 weeks for a decent laptop <600 and this is the only one http://www.futureshop.ca/en-CA/product/samsung-samsung-14-amd-a10-4600m-laptop-np355v4-s01ca-silver-np355v4-s01ca/10211638.aspx?path=bcd50fbb8392c92e7a14428964f6b5f1en02

Read full topic

item.title: Dell Inspiron 17R
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

It’s market price is $1,038.00, but I have a federal employee discount so I got $300.00 off. Then I added accessories and it topped off to $1k+ with Tax and shipping with was about $75 altogether.

So here are the specs for the laptop I have recently purchased. The total overall amount of money I spent was $1,084.92 with accessories added. I was wondering if these specs are worth the money. I did some research and came to conclude the only two issues with this laptop is hot air from the fan and short battery life.
